intro: Macarthuria australis, commonly known as the Australian macarthuria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pink or mauve, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Macarthuria australis is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
